inference:
1. Calculate the area of the playhouse wall and the two roof faces that will be covered with siding.
- Wall area: 8 feet x 6 feet = 48 square feet.
- Roof face 1 area: 1/2 x 8 feet x 5 feet = 20 square feet.
- Roof face 2 area: 1/2 x 8 feet x 5 feet = 20 square feet.
- Total area to be covered: 48 + 20 + 20 = 88 square feet.
2. Calculate the number of 8-foot by 12-foot sections of siding needed to cover the playhouse.
- 88 square feet / (8 feet x 12 feet) = 88 square feet / 96 square feet = 7/6 sections.
3. Calculate the number of 8-foot by 12-foot sections of siding that will be purchased.
- Since Sandy can cut the siding when she gets home, she will buy whole sections.
- 7/6 sections rounded up to the nearest whole number is 2 sections.
4. Calculate the cost of the siding.
- 2 sections x $27.30 per section = $54.60
Final Answer: \boxed{$54.60}. I hope it is correct.
ground_truth: Sandy will need to cover an $8$ by $6$ rectangle and two $8$ by $5$ rectangles. Thus, she will need to have at her disposal a sheet that is $8$ by $16$, so she should buy two $8$ by $12$ feet sections. The total price will be $2 \cdot \$ 27.30 = \boxed{ \$ 54.60}$.
